{"step_by_step_thinking": "The AHI (Apnea-Hypopnea Index) is a measure used to diagnose the severity of sleep apnea. It represents the average number of apneas (complete cessation of airflow) and hypopneas (partial reduction in airflow) per hour of sleep. Mild sleep apnea is generally defined as an AHI between 5 and 15. Therefore, the correct answer is A. >5.", "answer_choice": "A"}
